column2: freeway, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This mediciation has helped my pain better then anything. I'm so glad they changed it and took the yellow #5 dye out. I had to quit taking it because of interstitital cystitis. can not have yellow #5 dye in anything. I take this medication almost every day now for headaches and back pain. Is is great.

column9: Helps my back pain,relaxes me at night so I can sleep better.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more
column9: It helps me settle down and relax so the arthritis pain (wife) eases so I can go to sleep. (Husband)I take it to ease pain for neuropathy, and it also helps me to sleep.

column2: patagonia24, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Not quite sure how the new owner or manufacturer of the product can say it is the same product those of us have used for years.. and years.. and years. 325mg of acetaminophen and 25mg of diphenhydramine is not the original formula. Worse, it really doesn't justify the outrageous price they maintain. Maybe some sort of information about why this medication was changed?

column2: hartigan1943, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I want to know when the ingredients changed. I use this med only when I have a severe headache that no other pain reliever will relieve.

column9: I will never buy again since phenyltoloxamine citrate was removed. The original ingredients worked great, much better than most OTC pain relievers for my fibromyalgia. Now it is worthless. column2: daphy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Not sure how to rate this med now.  The old formulation was a miracle worker for those once or twice a year headaches that no other meds will touch.  But since they re-formulated it the drug is pretty worthless.  Now it is nothing more than benadryl plus tylenol.  Plus I was fairly upset that the box wasn't marked to inform consumers that it was re-formulated. I wasted over $10.00 on worthless meds that I will toss in the garbage.  I definitely would like to lodge an official complaint!

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: Carol,  Female  (Patient)
column9: Why oh why did the manufacturer change the drug? The label is the same and the box is the same BUT THE DRUG IS DIFFERENT! They added benadryl and took out the phenyltoloxamine. Nuh-uh. Lost ME as a customer!

column2: judy , 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have used Percogesic for migraines for over 5 years and found it to be excellent.  But the formulation change is unacceptable--not only is there no information about the change on the container, but the new ingredient is not at all a sleep aid for me rather it makes me hyper and I would never have chosen Percogesic if I had realized the formula had been changed to include it.  I consider what has been done to this product to be false advertising and illegal.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Percogesic used to be my favorite EFFECTIVE OTC pain reliever. The original antihistamine ingredient did not give me the creepy-crawly sensation that I always get from Benadryl. Why screw up a very effective pain reliever and why wasn't the change made visible on the packaging? Bad move, Percogesic. I won't be buying your product again.

column2: Bettyrn, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from migraine headaches since I was ten years old. A pharmacist suggested it to me when I was twenty years old, and I found it works better than any OTC meds and most presscription meds.  I am 61 years old and still use it.  I also now use it for chronic back pain and arthritis pain.

column2: upset6io8st, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Now that they have changes the ingredients in this product I will no longer buy it.  I have used this for over 25 years and now the product is just and over priced Tylonel

column2: lilvada02, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken this medication for some time now and it works for just about every kind of pain!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a migraine for approximately a week. I was in so much pain and was at the point where I was going to go to the dr to have him give me a prescription. I went to my local Walgreen's and asked the pharmisist what he would suggest and he suggested Percogesic. I had never heard of it before but was willing to try anything at that point. i took 2 pills and 2 hours later my pain went from excruciating to bearable. I highly recommend it to all of my friends.

column2: Davidson, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have used percogesic for many years and it has always worked very well as a sleep aid and for pain but I bought the last bottle walgreen's had and took one only to toss and turn ALL night.  I looked at the bottle, which I paid 10.00 for and it has an anihistimine in it.  I thought it was just an "Extra strenght" version, that is what it says on the box.  I am very frustrated.  I cannot use this bottle.  Lora
